reviews.review_msg: He's very difficult to understand and he has very high expectations for term papers. His lectures are poorly orgamized and he does not stay on topic. Someone from the history department should really be monitoring him and his teaching style. Worst prof in the department.
Great prof, clearly loves the subject material, relates well to the students and is always available to help the students when they need it

The Greece Field School is great because you get to go to Greece but Dimitrios will be on vacation so don't expect him to be available to you.  He won't deal with any of your concerns, so be prepared to live with problems or sort them out yourself. Overall he's prettey useless.

He was a good prof, interesting and approachable. He did assign a lot of reading and it was impossible to keep up, however he himself realized that as well near the end of the semester.. textbook, well i never opened it and still did failry well but essays were marked very tough, and he expected a very high caliber.
He thinks History has only one answer. This is not math
Dmitri rocked! If you are having some trouble just go have a chat with him.This guy made me LOVE Byzantine history.

Roman and Byzantine history has always interested me, but Krallis is not organized in teaching it. I found myself lost during sum of the lectures. Good text book though. I would have been better off just buying the textbook and not bothered to take the class.

This is my 5th course with him. I would say all of the readings in Hist307 are easy to read and understand. However, Doxis's 400 level courses are tough. All the readings are 50pages+, and you are expected to read 300-400 pages per week. Overall, Doxis is the best History Professor at SFU.
Really good Hist Prof, very detailed lecture, and interesting class, reading is little heavy but if you are 3rd or 4th year History student, you can manage it.

Amazing professor! Lectures are so engaging and he is super passionate about the topics he teaches that it is simply impossible to not fall in love of the history of the region as well. Took all the courses that he offered at SFU.

Jamie is everything a university professor should be. He has a wealth of knowledge, hes engaging, and respectful. He genuinely wants his students to develop an interest in the material. Excellent teacher and great guy.

Honestly, one of my favourite profs at SFU. I had no background knowledge in the class but he made it easy to understand, fun, and was really down to earth. He's understanding, and willing to give you extra time for assignments if you ask. Such a great prof!

Lectures are interesting. Readings are all provided via email and are well-related. He cares for students and is passionate about what he is teaching. Very kind and approachable. We had 3 quizzes, a paper proposal, and a final paper. Would definitely recommend.

Great professor, passionate, helpful and interested in the topic, get ready to work but be rewarded for it both in learning and grades, lineament with timelines tough with grades. Does not require text books but expects you to use some to support your study. Provides all necessary class material for free if you show you need it , helps with sources
